title: Drawing, "Design for Double Woven Cloth", ca. 1926
medium: Brush and watercolor, pen and black ink on wove paper, mounted on off-white mat board
provenance: Gunta Stölzl, Switzerland, ca. 1927-1983; Monika Stadler, Groningen, The Netherlands, 1983-2010
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Rectangular sheet consisting of large square blocks of blues, purples, steel gray, and salmon, bordered on all sides by smaller blocks of color and short lines of black ink, creating a staccato rhythm.
